transcripts.text: My country, you can't separate us.  Hey, what's up guys?  I'm in Taiwan right now, Taipei.  And right behind me is Taipei 101.  I'm going to try to angle it so you can see it.  Can you see it now?
Yeah.

Anyways, we're going to go talk to some Taiwanese people right now and see what they have to say about independence in China.  Let's go.  Man, it is so relaxing.  I'm just sitting here.  It's really... Nice and peaceful.  University students here?  Yeah.  What's the school's name?  Because I don't even know.  National Taiwan University.  And your major is?  Psychotherapy.  Psychotherapy.
There will be elections.
Yeah.  Is there like a China party?  Yeah.  And then a non-China party?  Kind of like independent party?  And a China party?
Yeah, KMT and DDP.

Okay, so for this election, who do you think will win?  The KMT?  I'm not sure.  Other generation that prefer KMT.  As a party, do you see the KMT people walking around and saying, hey, you should vote or something like that?  Try to push you?  I think both.  Both doing it.  So why do the old people like KMT and the young people don't?  Do you think the old people are crazy?  Why should Taiwan stay Taiwan and independent?
Because the government, the Chinese government, they always torture people like Xinjiang, Hong Kong.  It happened yesterday.
I heard someone got shot.  Yeah.  What do you know about the shooting?  What do you know about that?
He shoots him near the...
Oh, okay.  How do you feel about that?  It's very sad, very aggressive, full of anger.

Phase two begins when the protesters' target comes into view.  It's a police officer wearing riot gear.  He's carrying a large shield.  He is alone at this point.  The situation quickly escalates as the protesters rush towards him.  The police officer is running backwards and moments later he trips and falls to the ground.  The protesters surround the police officer and beat him.  Phase three, other police officers charge in.  A protester carrying a blue shield attempts to attack an officer.  That officer then shoots him with his revolver at point-blank range.
Off of the other officer, and then a protester hit him with a pipe.  Then he pulled the trigger.

The start of phase four is marked by protesters dispersing quickly.  A protester in a yellow helmet attempts to help the protester who was shot.  He is immediately tackled.  We then see a Molotov cocktail thrown at the police officers.  In a separate video, one of the first that appeared online about this incident, the shot protester is seen bleeding around his chest.  He says his chest is hurting and he needs to go to the hospital.

Do you think in Hong Kong many people will be killed?  Because you said China hates democracy.  Do you feel that Hong Kong is not free?  The power of China.  get over Hong Kong politics.  Right, kind of controlling Hong Kong's politics, yeah.  Yeah.  We watch news on TV.
Yeah.
